comments:
Test Scenario - JVEWRKB02 - Projects Interdependency test

Create and open a visual class extending JPanel called JPanel1.
Change the background color to blue and save the class.
Create and open another visual class extending JFrame called JFrame1.
Using the choose bean dialog drop JPanel1 onto the content pane of JFrame1.
Switch back to the JPanel1 editor and change the background color to green.
Save JPanel1.
This causes a SWT exception and a SWT error message is displayed "Save 
Failed:Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException).
Also when you switch back to the editor for JFrame1, the canvas is blank and 
can't be rebuilt (i.e. reload from scratch doesn't work).

Here's the exception:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Nov 07, 2003 11:49:01.424

This problem is blocking at least 2 testcases in the JVEWRKB02 scenario so I'm 
raising the severity to "major".

The following test case causes the same exception:
In the source of JPanel1, add the line import a.b.c; to the bottom of the 
import statements. 
Save the file, creating an error. 
Switch to JFrame1 
Verify that JFrame1 displays a red X on the Beans View for JPanel1, but 
displays otherwise 

Return to JPanel1 and remove the bogus import and save. 
Switch to JFrame1 
Verify that JFrame1 returns to displaying properly.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 46284 ***
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.
